Before that, I [lived|have lived|live|living] in London for two years. He [has finished|finished|finish|finishing] his homework just now. He [finished|has finished|finish|finishing] it an hour ago.

# ğŸ”‘ Lost Keys (Present Perfect vs. Past Simple)

The key to distinguishing them is:
1. Does it affect 'now'?
2. Is the time 'finished' (yesterday, last year)?

1. **[have lost]**: Keys are still lost now. (Present relevance)
2. **[lost]**: happened Yesterday (Finished time).
3. **[have visited]**: Life experience (Unfinished time frame).
4. **[visited]**: happened Last year (Finished time).
5. **[have lived]**: Started in past, continues now.
6. **[lived]**: Lived in past, not anymore.
7. **[has finished]**: Just finished (Connection to now).
8. **[finished]**: An hour ago (Finished time).

title: Food Experience
content: I [have eaten|ate] sushi before. She [has tried|tried] spicy food. We [have tasted|tasted] durian. They [have cooked|cooked] dinner.

title: Travel Logs
content: He [has been|was] to Paris. I [have visited|visited] Rome. We [have traveled|traveled] significantly. She [has flown|flew] in a helicopter.
explanation-zh-TW: Travel experience without time: Present Perfect.
explanation-zh-CN: Travel experience without time: Present Perfect.

title: Just Done
content: I [have just finished|finished just] my work. She [has just left|left just]. We [have just arrived|arrived just]. They [have just eaten|ate just].

title: Never Ever
content: [Have you ever|Did you ever] seen a ghost? I [have never|did never] been there. She [has never|never] eaten snake. [Has he ever|Did he ever] called you?

title: Since 2010
content: I [have lived|lived] here since 2010. She [has worked|worked] here since May. We [have known|knew] him since childhood. He [has been|was] sick since Monday.

title: For Ten Years
content: I [have waited|waited] for 2 hours. She [has studied|studied] for 5 years. They [have been|were] married for a long time. He [has played|played] for 30 minutes.

title: Already and Yet
content: I [have already|already] done it. [Have you finished|Did you finish] yet? She [has not come|didn't come] yet. We [have already|already] seen it.

title: How Long?
content: [How long have you lived|How long did you live] here? (still living). [How long has she known|How long did she know] him? [How long have they been|How long were they] married?
explanation-zh-TW: How long with Present Perfect for continuing state.
explanation-zh-CN: How long with Present Perfect for continuing state.

title: Accomplishments
content: Man [has walked|walked] on the moon. Science [has cured|cured] many diseases. We [have built|built] tall towers. Technology [has changed|changed] our lives.

title: Recent Changes
content: The price [has gone|went] up. The weather [has become|became] cold. She [has grown|grew] taller. My phone [has broken|broke].

title: Multiple Times
content: I [have seen|saw] this movie three times. She [has called|called] twice. We [have been|were] there many times. He [has read|read] it often.

title: This Week
content: I [have worked|worked] hard this week. (Week not over). She [has drunk|drank] two coffees today. We [have not seen|didn't see] him this month.

title: Gone vs Been
content: She [has gone|has been] to Italy (She is there now). I [have been|have gone] to Italy (I am back). He [has gone|has been] out. We [have been|have gone] there before.

title: News
content: The President [has arrived|arrived]. The police [have arrested|arrested] the thief. A new store [has opened|opened]. The team [has won|won].
